title: Doom [the movie]
content:
The Doom movie 'thing' will be released on 21 October.

There is already a trailer out, watch it [url=http://media.filmforce.ign.com/media/490/490104/vids_1.html]here.[/url]

Am I the only one who thinks it looks all very old and uninteresting.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/upload/logo/image_multijpeg/DevilFrogVerwandlung.jpg[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jiw/img/US_logo_big.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: well...
content: A lot of the feedback I've been reading has said that this preview looks an awful lot like the preview for the original Resident Evil movie.  To me, it looks campy and parody-like, similar to the original Evil Dead movie.  Only time will tell, but from watching this original preview, the whole thing looks like it's trying to be a B-quality movie from the get-go.

title: Re: well...
content:
I think I agree with both of the above post; the trailer makes it look like a very generic horror movie, and it doesn't seem like there will be any great acting performances either.

It's Doom though, so for nostalgia's sake...
Only... it's Doom III, not Doom/Doom II, so probably not many familiar things either, since I didn't play 3 yet.

Thanks for the link.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: well...
content:
It's been pretty much confirmed through interviews and such which took place at the San Diego Comic Con that such early DooM creatures as the Barons of Hell and the Pinky demons will be appearing--though it's not known in what form. One of the interviews yielded a quote about the Pinky demon being "a viscious little bastard," and that one word worried me a bit. :-\

We'll see.

title: Re: well...
content:
The trailer looks ok. Who knows if it will be good or not but most likely better than that piece of crap the mario movie was. At least theres shooting and guns in the doom movie since the mario movie basicly had nothing to do with Mario except for the names and marios and luigis costumes at the climax.Check out my blog at [url=http://spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/]spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/[/url]

title: Re: well...
content: Ugh, I thought the trailer was awful. I'm horrified that they casted "The Rock". [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] [img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Re: well...
content:
Yeah, the Rock is a bad cast. But then, again, he looks the role of Sarge. It is just that his film record sucks. Still, it is better than Vin Diesel.

The movie looks better than expected. Originally, the film was going to PG-13 and have the demons simply be aliens. But this looks like an improvement from that. As for being campy, the original Doom and Doom II games were pretty campy. Doom II especially. I mean, they were fun games, but they were kind of funny at times. And some of the Doom II music sounded like carnival songs.*** --- I Am Keen is hell bent for leather. Are you? --- ***

title: Re: well...
content:
judgeing by the way the trailer is cut, the movie is going to suck!
i can't express enough how i hate american-like-cut (actionstyle) movies because they are way to fastpaced, no tension or atmosphere and silly acting like "get the hell out of here!" ect...

they could have made the movie much more epic, like Aliens mixed with Fellowship of the ring...

they should have made the movie with that odd, surreal "judgement day" feeling the original games had.

lol, but what can you expect from hollywood most of the times... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-deadkeenvort.gif[/img]

title: Re: well...
content:
Hmmm, according to the site linked to above, it is a teaser (trailer).
Also there doesn't seem to be a whole lot of information about the story, although I suppose maybe there is more than your average teaser.
Then there's the fact Doom III doesn't have the most fleshed out of stories (at least I think, I didn't get to play the game yet), so maybe that's the entire story right there in that little video. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]they should have made the movie with that odd, surreal "judgement day" feeling the original games had.[hr][/quote]

Well, it's a movie adaptation of D3, not D/D2.
Of course talk of a movie started around the original Doom days, so one can't but wonder what the movie would've been like if they did decide to make one around that time...
At least I can't.
Until I play D3 and like it, the original Doom is the "real" Doom for me.Retodon8
